p:
The porosity of the biomaterial is one of its key features with regard to tissue engineering, including bone implant application
10, 31 . The analysis of the BC membrane used for impregnation with EOs showed that it displays an average surface area of 9.56 ± 0.83 m 2/g, average pore volume of 3.42 ± 0.04 cm 3/g and average pore diameter of 0.24 ± 0.01 nm. Several other research teams confirmed that the highly porous BC structure is one of the greatest advantages of this biomaterial when used for such medical applications as impregnation with active substances
20, 27, 32 .
